Main content start



 

 
Confidential / Independent / Informal / Impartial
The Ombuds Office is a confidential resource available to all faculty, staff, postdocs, and students who are experiencing a conflict or issue that is interfering with their academic or work life at Stanford.
The Ombuds will listen without judgment; offer information about policies and procedures, and help individuals identify and evaluate the different options available to address their concerns. The Ombuds Office is also a good place to confidentially raise concerns or recommendations for systems-level change. All meetings are kept strictly confidential and individuals remain in control of how they wish to address their concerns. There are two Ombuds Offices at Stanford. This office serves university members outside of the School of Medicine and the SOM Ombuds Office serves members of the community at the School of Medicine.
Communications with the Ombuds does not put Stanford on notice of the communication.
Read more about how the Ombuds can help.
Used the Ombuds before? Please fill out a confidential survey
